after you install it, run 'dpkg -L lzma | grep bin' and look for programs with 'un' in the name. that should do it.
sorry i want to extract texlive.iso.lzma
ok, just checking. because iso files are usually cd images.
7zip uses lzma as it's primary compression algorithm, but it's not the same.
you need to install the 'lzma' package if it isn't already.
indian_munnda: sorry if i don't make sense, i'm getting confused by helping two people at once.
to decompress .lzma files, you need the 'lzma' package, which contains 'unlzma' inside of it, the decompression program.
i check it,in SYNAPTIC already exist lzma package
than run 'unlzma texlive.iso.lzma' to decompress the file
chances are, this is a cd image. you need to mount it as if it were a normal cd drive to access the files in it (after decompression)
create a directory to mount it on, via 'mkdir texlive'
then run 'sudo mount -o loop -t iso9660 texlive.iso texlive' and you should be able to see the files in 'texlive'
